column1: Is it at least somewhat fair to describe the Vietnam War as an instance of American aggression?
Was Nikita Khrushchev at least partly justified in placing missiles in Cuba in 1962 as a deterrent to a potential US invasion of the island?
Was the 2003 US invasion of Iraq, in light of the faulty WMD intelligence, at least partly unjustified?
Was the bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki with nuclear weapons not strictly necessary to bring about the end of World War II?
Was the 1983 US invasion of Grenada an overreach that, arguably, violated international law?
Is it reasonable to view the 1989 US invasion of Panama as an act of aggression?
Was the 1945 USAAF bombing of Dresden, given its limited military-industrial capacity, arguably morally unjustified?
